result.execSummary:
The defendant Tarsh Artez Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (19 pages) commencing 01-06-2016 received and filed.  CH
Associated with Charge #2

Defendant Tarsh Artez Smith in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  7 YEARS with 15 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  7 YEARS with 15 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution set at zero; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Case in court to address Justice Point violation.  Court admonishes the defendant, and amends bail.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22 for sentencing on 11/18/2015 at 8:30am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  Positive drug test.  Parties instructed to report to Branch 22 immediately for bail review.

Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 11/16/2015 is vacated.  As to Counts 1 & 2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tarsh Artez Smith in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered Count 1 amended to Possession with Intent to Deliver Controlled Substance (Cocaine)(>5-15 grams), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 941.41(1m)(cm)2 and 939.50(3)(e), a Class E Felony.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Tarsh Artez Smith in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Katie Seelow for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference, defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Court also addresses Justice Point violation.  Court admonished defendant but does not amend bail. Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
